Product Id: Estimates contained in this table have been assigned a letter to indicate their coefficient of variation (c.v.) (expressed as a percentage). The letter grades represent the following coefficients of variation: A is used for a c.v. between or equal to 0.00% and 5.00% and means Excellent, B is used for a c.v. between or equal to 5.01% and 15.00% and means Very good, C is used for a c.v. between or equal to 15.01% and 25.00% and means Good, D is used for a c.v. between or equal to 25.01% and 35.00% and means Acceptable, E is used for a c.v. greater than 35.00% and means Use with caution.
Trips with a destination outside of Canada or at least one night spent outside of Canada made by residents of Canada 18 years of age or older.
Overseas countries are countries other than the United States.

A Person-trip represents a trip taken by one person. A trip has one origin and one destination and it can include one or more visits, with the number of visits always equal to or greater than the number of trips.
Other tables will be available at a later date.
Final data for the first quarter of 2020 represent only January and February 2020.
